data.title: Old Established Candy Store
data.text: Lived in West Allis all my life. Freese's Candy has been there long as I can remember. We love there selection of Fine Chocolates. It's my Husband's Go To Place to Surprise me with all my Favorites.

data.title: Talk about Sweet!
data.text:
I ventured into the Freese's Candy Shoppe and was warmly greeted. I asked for a milk chocolate butter creme. They looked inviting so I bought three. As I exited the story, I took a bite.
It was so sweet that I could not finish one. It took me 20 minutes to finish that one so I would not feel any sugar after effects.
Sorry; I am sticking with Fannie Mae.

data.title: Gigantic Turtles - fabulous!
data.text: I have lived in WI all my life, and I never get my chocolate anywhere else now. I live in Mount Pleasant and never hesitate to make the 45 minute drive to buy gifts or when I am craving a great whipped cream stick (which I can only get here since the demise of The Chocolate House) or the Turtles (which are fabulous and gigantic!). The Fairy Food is second to none and the Mint Meltaways are creamy and smooth. Have trouble with choosing?The prepacked boxes are a lifesaver! So much chocolate - so little time. Do not pass this place up - it will become your favorite, too!

data.title: Fairy Food
data.text: The fairy food is the best I've ever had. A small, mom and pop store that you should give your money to instead of large chains. I buy client gifts there as well as for myself... and I shop as often as my diet will allow me!

data.title: Love their nuts
data.text:
Freeses' nuts are quite heavenly. They roast them with a mixture of cinnamon, sugar, and heat to create a candy coating that is divine. There is achieve of cashews, almonds, and pecans ( I prefer the pecans ). Every time I've been there I've been satisfied. 

For the chocolate and marshmallow lover, try their homemade confections- they won't disappoint.

data.title: Do not stand behind their sales
data.text: I called the store to have some chocolates delivered to my parents prior to Valentine's Day.  My first call was to see if they would mail out chocolate covered cherries.  I called back later in the day to make the actual purchase and provide the  address, etc. for mailing.  I talked to two different people.  Neither one of them cautioned that they did not "guarantee" delivery of chocolate covered cherries.  I was very disappointed today when I called to inform them of the condition of the cherries upon arrival -- smashed beyond belief and inedible -- and offered to send them a picture  No offer was made to ameliate my dissatisfaction other than repeating several times that "we do not guarantee the delivery of chocolate covered cherries."    NOW they tell me -- after they shipped them?

data.title: Chocolate Heaven!
data.text: First of all, this photograph was not taken in the City of Greenfield. It is the storefront of Freese's in the City of West Allis, 7312 West Greenfield Avenue. That being said, Freese's has been creating the best chocolates since 1928. Four generations of my family have shopped here. Be sure to stop in before Easter and see the incredible selection of molded chocolates. The fairy food is the best on Earth and the pecan turtles are to die for. The shoppe may look tiny on the outside, but the flavor explosion waiting inside will keep you coming back again and again.

data.title: Best Candy Shop Ever!!!
data.text:
This store opened in 1928. How is that for longevity? Prices are very reasonable, considering the quality of the chocolates & the love that goes into making them in the back room.

After tasting their candies, you will never go back to Fannie May or Frango. We just discovered Freese's on this trip, but we shall visit it every time we go to Milwaukee from now on. A wonderful experience in an awesome store! The ladies who work there are so pleasant. Again, nicest candy store we've ever been in!!
